channel.title: Homework_1 on Andrea's Statistics Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Homework_1 on Andrea's Statistics Blog

item.title: Homework 4, application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Generate a m sequences of n trials distributed according a Binomial with success probability p and represent the following quantities: absolute frequency of success, relative frequency of success, "normalized" relative frequency of success,
  • in the same chart, add also a vertical histogram representing the distribution of the above 3 types of frequencies on the last trial.

item.title: Homework 4, research
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Illustrate the parallel between the properties of the relative frequency and the axioms for probability,
  • discuss some concrete examples of Measure Space (omega,epsilon,P),
  • illustrate how Measure Theory provides the mathematical foundation for Probability.

item.title: Homework 4, research on application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Give a simple introduction to graphics in the .NET environment. How to create a bitmap and a chart on it,
  • explain in simple terms how to get device coordinates from world coordinates.

item.title: Homework 3, research on application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • A survey on online algorithms (Welford),
  • in particular, Knuth recursion for the computation of the arithmetic mean (average).

item.title: Homework 3, application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Create a distribution from the data obtained by the program WireShark by reading the CSV file generated by the program.

item.title: Homework 3, research
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Illustrate the concept of conditional, joint, marginal (relative) frequency using a simple bivariate distribution,
  • illustrate the concept of statistical independence and the resulting mathematical relationships between the above frequencies.

item.title: Homework 2, application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • make a simple program which uses the objects Random and Timer
  • Make a simple CSV parser
  • Compute an univariate distribution of a variable

item.title: Homework 2, research
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Concept of distribution. Univariate and multivariate. Conditional and marginal distributions.

item.title: Homework 1, application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Create simple applications in C# and VBNet to play with event handlers, understanding the syntax differences between the two languages.

item.title: Homework 1, research
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Give a definition of statistics,
  • What is a dataset? From the observation units to the dataset. Attributes and variables,
  • Find and list interesting applications of statistics to cybersecurity problems.

item.title: Homework 1, research on application
item.description:
Assignment:

  • Main differences between C# and VB.NET

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there, my name is Andrea, I am a graduate student in computer engineering and now a student in the master’s degree in Cybersecurity at “La Sapienza”. This blog is hosted with GitHub pages and made with Hugo a framework for building websites. Also, if youâ€™re interested about my other past projects, I invite you to check out my Github.
